title: Flipped Learning-Based ADHD Understanding and Educational Strategy Development Course

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Short intensive course conducted via flipped learning for pre-/in-service teachers to acquire practical knowledge for supporting students with ADHD

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core symptoms, diagnostic criteria, and educational environment adaptation strategies for ADHD.
Learners can propose customized lesson design plans for ADHD students by utilizing flipped learning pre-learning materials.
Learners can develop activity plans for improving the social skills of ADHD students in summative assessments, incorporating at least three strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
